content:
I cannot access real-time information, but there are likely many interfaith events and initiatives happening soon that you can find by searching online or checking with interfaith organizations in your local area. here are a few examples of ongoing interfaith initiatives:

1. the parliament of the world's religions: this is a global organization that promotes interfaith understanding and cooperation. they host a conference every few years that brings together people of different religions to share their perspectives and work on shared issues.

2. interfaith youth core: this is an organization that works to empower young people of different faiths to work together for social change. they offer leadership training, resources, and support for young people who want to build bridges between faith communities.

3. world interfaith harmony week: this is an annual event that takes place in the first week of february. it was established by the united nations to promote harmony and understanding between different religions. many interfaith organizations around the world host events during this week to celebrate and promote interfaith dialogue and cooperation.

4. national day of prayer: this is a day that is observed in the united states on the first thursday of may. it is an opportunity for people of different faiths to come together and pray for the well-being of the nation and the world.

these are just a few examples of ongoing interfaith initiatives. there are many other events and organizations that promote interfaith dialogue and understanding.
